My research agenda is centred around economic questions related to rural dynamics in developing countries, particularly financial behaviour, labour and cognition of households in rural South India.
The methods I use are determined by the research questions that arise but revolve around rigorous statistical analysis (e.g., econometrics, machine learning).
I attach great importance to the quality of the data used, and in the interests of transparency and respect for ethical principles, all the R and Stata scripts developed to conduct the statistical and econometric analyses of my research work are freely accessible [here](https://github.com/arnaudnatal).
